titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Ewing Forth, Indictment
CWG6478

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hart Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Ewing Forth

The Grand Jury of Hart County In the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse, Ewing Forth of the offense of Keeping a Tippling house committed as follows to wit The said Ewing Forth heretofore to=wit on the day of 1865 in the County aforesaid. and on divers other days before and since then and before the finding of this Indictment. Did unlawfully keep a Tippling house and that he did so unlawfully keep Said Tippling house for three months at one time against the peace and dignity of the said Commonwealth

Wm B. Jones
Attorney for the Commonwealth

Information of
W A Smith
W E Wells.
B F Hatcher.
Wm Reynolds,
F M Kelly,
Smal Renfro
Ewing
W C Wells,
Phil Buckner

Copy Att J. H. Compton C. H. C. C.
By John H Lively D. C.
Is there Judgt on this Indicts by confession Dawson
